title: Destruction of Print Media
selftext:
I have been reading the Hindu for the past year, and it is astonishing how a newspaper so respected and accorded with value by academics around the country has succumbed to the clutches of advertisements.

They have started to run full front page ads, and almost every page is filled with them

I woke up today, picked up the paper and found almost the entire second and third page (slide 3) filled with ads, using columns which were reserved for city news. 

I honestly think that reporting in the Hindu is still outstanding and their editorials are just [insert chef's kiss]. But it is saddening to see how the print media is suffering in a time when the TV media is just retarded.
comments: More and more people have given up on reading newspapers. Even people who actually read news articles, prefer reading them online rather than subscribing to a physical copy. These print newspapers need profit someway. Not saying it's right but it is what it is

Bro The Hindu is one of newspapers which have least no. of circulation throughout the country.

They have to print ads in order to make money.
If we all are gonna start paying donations to the credible news sources, then maybe they will tone down the number of the ads that they have to print.
Print media is still 100 times better than electronic media.
How do you think they will pay for expenses?
